TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TableNameAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Provides an attribute to change the displayed name for a table.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name that the table will display.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified name for the table.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.TableNameAttribute> attribute is used to change the entity name in the metadata when there are entity name conflicts from multiple contexts. The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.TableNameAttribute> attribute should not be used to change the display name. Instead, use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DisplayNameAttribute> attribute to change the display name.
## Examples The following example shows how to set the table name. In the example, the displayed table name is changed from "ProductModelProductDescriptions" to "Prod Model Desc".
[!code-cs[System.Web.DynamicData.TableNameAttribute#11](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/ClassLibrary1/ProductModelProductDescription.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.Web.DynamicData.TableNameAttribute#11](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/System.Web.DynamicData.TableNameAttribute.ClassLibrary1/ProductModelProductDescription.vb#11)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the table.
Docs.value: The name that is associated with a table.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this property to map a table name to a unique name when another table in a different data context has the same name.
